hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Squeeze Breakout with Regime Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day Bollinger Band width contracts below its 20-day average (volatility squeeze) during a NEUTRAL regime, and price then closes above the upper band on above-average volume, a momentum breakout to the upside will occur, with the move extending at least 1.5x the squeeze width.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral markets often precedes directional moves. The regime filter avoids false breakouts during strong trends or stress. Volume confirmation reduces whipsaw risk.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day BB width < 20-day avg BB width for 3 consecutive days
BTC closes above 10-day upper Bollinger Band

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches entry price + (1.5 * BB width at entry)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below 10-day middle Bollinger Band
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days if TP/SL not hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such signals result in a failed breakout (price returns inside bands within 2 days) or fail to reach 1x squeeze width target.
